bug.short_desc: redirecting standard input

long_desc.thetext:
In a program using standard input, I was unable to redirect it to a file.
In Debug mode it works fine but in a normal Run it doesn't.
Using:
< ${workspace_loc:tcmake}/data
In Run/Arguments where "data" was a data file for tcmake

The actual problem is that there is no feature to redirect input from a file. This makes it difficult to debug programs that expect to read from the stdin stream, like many command-line utilities do.
From a UI standpoint, you can see the problem in the Run or Debug dialog box and the Common tab. In that tab is a set of fields labeled "Standard Input and Output". And there is a check box to redirect stdout to a file, but nothing for stdin. Can we get that added?
By the way, this bug applies to all hardware and OS platforms, however I couldn't change the fields. Can someone else update those?
Changed hardware and OS to "all" (suggestion of nradov@axolotl.com)

bug.short_desc: Eclipse/CDT interface breaks without warning, bad interface, indexer problems, some general gripes...

long_desc.thetext:
I'm using Eclipse 3.1.2 with CDT 3.0.2. I'm using MinGW 4.1 and associated tools for compilation and debugging. I'm relatively new to Eclipse, I've been using Eclipse for about 4 months. I'm using Eclipse because it doesn't cost anything, and it is (overall, barring stuff below) a well-developed and powerful program.
Forgive me if I'm rambling on here, this is the sum of various things about Eclipse that have pissed me off. I;m not even sure if all this should all be in one message, it may need to be split up into several bugs, feature requests, etc..
I've been creating some C code using both managed make and standard make, and have found some problems with the interface. In all of these projects I ahve been using SVN.
First of all, the interface is really really poor in some areas. For instance, right clicking on an executable and selecting 'Debug' brings up the debug window - but no means of actually setting up a debug configuration! I'm trying to work it out (again!) now - it seems to be different every single time I run Eclipse. Actually, I just got this to work, but what is the actual difference between "Debug Local C/C++ Application" and "Debug..."? The latter should be given a better name. I didn't pick the first becuase I thought that meant that the configuration already had to be set up.
Also, the configurations just seem to break without warning. I've been using this set up for a couple of days, then just now launching the debugger (GDB) fails with the infamous "Cannot set program arguments..." error, and of course the "Details >>>" button does not give any more useful information, like telling you what application actually caused the error (amazing!). Or why are there three errors and the last two are indented?
I admit my setup is probably not the best. I have MinGW and Eclipse installed in the "C:\Program Files\..." directory tree. However, I believe this is a realistic ask. I have my code in my "My Documents" directory tree, which has several spaces somewhere along the line (C:\Documents and Settings\Bartholomew Milne\...). I do not want to change this to a directory path without spaces, as that would involve even more jiggery-pokery (which I'm not at all up for) to ensure security remains intact. It's a fact of life, Windows directories and file names are going to have spaces in them. Deal with it.
Eclipse's behaviour seems to be really inconsistent in some areas. For instance, I had a Managed Make C/C++ project (writing in C), and the build part worked fine. Then one day, it stopped dead. Just wouldn't work. I found out that it was calling 'make' even though I didn't actually have 'make' (I actually have 'mingw32-make'). For reasons known only to Eclipse it worked, my projects built. That's OK (I didn't even notice that I didn't have 'make'), but why did it stop working all of a sudden? I didn't do anything to change it, all I did was try to 'use' it (people actually do that?).
Now I'm in a similar situation with the debugger. Install latest version of GDB debugger (into MinGW directory tree), it has worked fine for a few days, now it won't work, for no apparent reason. OK, there is always a reasonable explanation, but it seems to be something that is not intuitive to me and frankly I'm not interested anyway. I'm using it, not developing it. I'm more interested in Eclipse working properly so I can get my program working properly.
Finally, the C/C++ indexer. My index got corrupted. The first time was because I had some source files with identical names to some I was working on in another directory (old versions for refrence in a folder \OLD\...). However, the Indexer, in its infinite wisdom, decided that the source files in the 'old' directory were the ones the ones that were producing the executable. This wasn't the case, so the debugger would show places in the code that were obviously incorrect. Another side effect: there's that very helpful 'outline' pane on the right hand side of the screen. I click on a function name and it goes to wrong place. I make clean all, which seems to clear the indexer. No change in bahvaiour. And I can't figure out how to make the indexer do what I want (you should be able to do that from the interface). I can't make it restart (I have read that you in fact can force the indexer to strat again from scratch, thereby correcting the problem, but there should be a button that soed it all for you).
I would like to help to fix some of these problems, but I do not have much spare time and my Java is not very good (I'm more of a C man). Also, as hinted earlier, I'm more interested in using the software than having to deal with seemingly silly bugs and problems.
If you need more information, feel free to reply and ask.
Thanks, Bart Milne
Yes, please break this up into individual bug reports.

bug.short_desc: [activity] Date chooser: allow week to start on Mondays

long_desc.thetext:
Where I live, weeks start on Mondays. It would be nice if there were some proferences.
This is Mylar 0.6.0 on Eclipse 3.2 on Windows

The idea of the work week starting on Monday is alos part of Mylar's planning support, so this should be the default presentation. Generally configurable work weeks would be another enhancement request, but could overly complicate the UI.
Rob, as part of this change you should consider showing this and the next month, getting rid of the month combo, and just adding "<" and ">" buttons to go back and forward between months.
The date picker will be overhauled as part of the ui review for 1.0. We will address this problem then.
By the way, can we see two months in the date picker? Current one is really inconvenient at the end of the month.

Would the Mylar team benefit from having someone else carry the burden of the date picker/chooser widget? Nebula has voted in the one I have been working on and it will be uploaded to their repository within the next few weeks. In the mean time, it can be seen at its current home: http://www.aspencloud.com/widgets.php?detail=cdatepicker
(it is i18n'ed and should also take care of https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=135930)

(In reply to comment #3) > By the way, can we see two months in the date picker? Current one is really > inconvenient at the end of the month.
I should also mention that although the CDatepicker, mentioned in comment #4, does not show two months, it does scroll vertically by week to eliminate this "end-of-month boundary" problem.
Excellent! It looks great and I'm looking forward to integrating it.

It would be great if we could reuse the date picker from Nebula and we have always hoped that the responsibility of maintaining this widget would eventually fall elsewhere since it is needed by so many.
Jeremy: we would need to redistribute Nebula with our download. For the short term it probably makes sense for us to do redistribute it in binary form rather than creating an update site dependency. Could you please point us to the download once it becomes available?

(In reply to comment #7) > Could you please point us to the > download once it becomes available?
Just as an update - the widget is in IpZilla right now; I'll definitely let you all know when it is actually uploaded to Nebula.
It will need a bit of refining I'm sure, but making a binary for distribution with Mylar should not be a problem.
cheers

Is this the same that is described in bug 19945 or are these two different implementations?
Gerd

(In reply to comment #9) > Is this the same that is described in bug 19945 or are these two different > implementations?
These are two different implementations - the SWT widget (included in 3.3M3) will be using native components where available and emulated ones where they are not. My widget (CDateTime once it hits Nebula) is be completely emulated. Unlike the SWT widget, CDateTime is primarily focused on providing the best possible UI for a task related date/time selection (it was initially created for a contact manager I'm working on). I jumped into bug 19945 with comment #20 to try and coordinate the api with SWT's, but this has been unsuccessful.

With Mylar's general philosophy of always decreasing the number of clicks required to get stuff done, we have the important requirement that most of the time the dialog should not require more than 2 clicks to pick a date and time, and rarely require more than 4 (year, month, day, hour). This is why we currently inline the month and hour selection and make the dialog so large.
Jeremy: could you attach a screenshot of your widget? I'd us to think through how many clicks scheduling will take.

Created an attachment (id=53907) Screenshots of the CDateTime widget on Linux GTK
Please note that these are of the graphical selection portion of the CDateTime widget. It can also be used a textual-only widget (with a spinner for inc/dec) as well as a drop_down combo, in which case the graphical portion shown will drop down when the button is pressed.

(In reply to comment #11) > Jeremy: could you attach a screenshot of your widget? I'd us to think through > how many clicks scheduling will take.
The analog clock has the ability to have an increment set so that it "snap" to, say, 15 minute increments. This has not been completed for the discrete clock, but may improve it some, especially if 1 hour granularity is all that's needed. Additionally, the discrete clock may benefit from a 2x12 hour format for locales which are not using the 24 hour format (thoughts?).
Overall, I want to stress that this widget is *emulated*, meaning that although it is important for it to feel native (native colors, buttons, menus, etc) it is not bound by any platform's implementation and can be modified to suit the needs of time/task management applications - if there's a better way I'll be glad to implement it (and if people want to help with that implementation then so much the better! :))
We will look at adopting this new widget post 1.0.
I don't really fancy analog representation. And discrete representation is imho not quite intuitive. I also wonder how friendly these widgets to the mouseless navigation?

(In reply to comment #15) > I also wonder how friendly these widgets to the mouseless navigation?
I've tried to clarify this more on the website: http://www.eclipse.org/nebula/widgets/cdatetime/cdatetime.php?page=operation. CDateTime is intended to function fully with either a keyboard, mouse, or pen. If a case is found to be lacking, please file a bug.
> I don't really fancy analog representation. And discrete representation is > imho not quite intuitive.
What time representation do you fancy? (this is custom and open to suggestions)

Jeremy: I would like us to improve the date/time selection for Mylar 2.0 and I definitely like the idea of using Nebula for that. The thing that we always try to do with the Mylar UI is minimize the number of clicks as much as possible. For time/date selection we try to keep it down to two clicks, and three if the month has to be changed. That's why we have been shying away from drop-downs and analog clocks. My main problems with our current dialog are: * The vertical month chooser should never have a scroll bar, since there can only ever be 12 things in it. * The day chooser should be the current Nebula widget since it is considerably better. * The hour chooser should start on the work-day start hour, not at 12am. * The resulting date should be editable as text within the dialog itself (e.g. for choosing minutes)
So I'm wondering, is this a direction that you would consider for the Nebula widget, or should we be trying to make a hybrid Mylar/Nebula chooser?

(In reply to comment #17) > So I'm wondering, is this a direction that you would consider for the Nebula > widget, or should we be trying to make a hybrid Mylar/Nebula chooser?
Mik, After some thought, I think that this would be a good addition to CDateTime - it presently has a 'COMPACT' style which takes it in the opposite direction (small visual footprint, but more clicks required), and I think the addition of a 'VERBOSE' style may work well for the requirements you have described (fewer clicks, with less concern about visual footprint).
> ... analog clocks.
Just to mention it: analog clocks are great for viewing time - relative time - and not so much for selecting it. Likewise, I also wouldn't expect to see Mylar make much use of it.
> * The hour chooser should start on the work-day start hour, not at 12am.
How would the user set the work day? And how would they select times that are not during the work day? As a user, this feature has always caused me problems - especially if I'm using the app for working on open source (after hours) projects.
> * The resulting date should be editable as text within the dialog itself (e.g. > for choosing minutes)
I don't understand this concern - if a user is setting a date/time via the mouse, and has the option of setting minutes, they shouldn't be required to switch input devices. Also, it seemed that the date/time selector is always opened from a text widget - couldn't they set the minutes there rather than opening another shell? Perhaps I missed where this is necessary?
Finally, with the modular design of CDateTime, the most difficult part is deciding how this selector should be laid out - if anyone has suggestions please attach a drawing/picture.
cheers!

(In reply to comment #18) > How would the user set the work day? And how would they select times that are > not during the work day? As a user, this feature has always caused me problems > - especially if I'm using the app for working on open source (after hours) > projects.
Mylar has a preference for workday start and end and uses this to facilitate scheduling. If someone works on other projects on evenings, they can just set the length of their workday accordingly. Not to mention that there's no big problem with working "afterhours" from the Task List's point of view, other than the fact that things that didn't get done today but were supposed to go red.
The bottom line is that it would be helpful if this widget could take a workdayStart parameter so that it could be scrolled to the appropriate time.
> > * The resulting date should be editable as text within the dialog itself (e.g. > > for choosing minutes) > I don't understand this concern - if a user is setting a date/time via the > mouse, and has the option of setting minutes, they shouldn't be required to > switch input devices. Also, it seemed that the date/time selector is always > opened from a text widget - couldn't they set the minutes there rather than > opening another shell? Perhaps I missed where this is necessary?
I was suggesting that the UI retain our current property of not providing a quick way to set minutes. Nobody has every complained about the fact that we don't support this, because it is such a rare operation, and they know that they can manually edit the date in the corresponding field editor. So what I'm suggesting is taking that text field editor and putting it in the widget itself. This has two benefits, and the cost of only one row: * A human readable date shows in the widget (e.g. at the bottom). * The full date can be edited directly (e.g. to set minutes) or copied as text.
> Finally, with the modular design of CDateTime, the most difficult part is > deciding how this selector should be laid out - if anyone has suggestions please > attach a drawing/picture.
The layout I was suggesting is our current date chooser, but with the changes described above (e.g. right-click on task -> Schedule -> Choose Date...). Let me know if you'd like me to attach a screenshot.

attachment.desc: Screenshots of the CDateTime widget on Linux GTK

bug.short_desc: Task Editor: inconsistent date formats

long_desc.thetext:
This is Mylar 0.6.0, Eclipse 3.2, German Windows
the field 'Scheduled for' uses an American date format(07/10/06 11PM), creation date a German (10. Juli 2006).

This is a recognized issue (bug# 138837) and I hope to get to it this week. Thanks for the feedback.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 138837 ***

bug.short_desc: [Help][Context] Remove the link of dynamic help from the infopopup of the context help.

long_desc.thetext: When the context help is opened in the infopopup, this info popup also contains the link to the dynamic help with the other defined link. There is no way to remove this link.

The link was intended to ensure that the new (and preferred) dynamic help view/tray is easily accessible and that users are avare of it. Do you want to remove it because you have problems while following the link or you just don't like it?

(In reply to comment #1) > The link was intended to ensure that the new (and preferred) dynamic help > view/tray is easily accessible and that users are avare of it. Do you want to > remove it because you have problems while following the link or you just don't > like it?
Thanks for reply
Actually i do not want to use dynamic help view in my application. Is it possible to remove that link from the infopop?.
Actually i want to disable all the features of dyanmic help in my application.

(In reply to comment #1) > The link was intended to ensure that the new (and preferred) dynamic help > view/tray is easily accessible and that users are avare of it. Do you want to > remove it because you have problems while following the link or you just don't > like it?
Is this flexibility not available in Eclipse? One of the reason i could think of why Dynamic Help view is not desirable is that when Dynamic Help view appears in some perspective it reduces the available area for the exsiting views in the perspective. I believe it would be a good idea to provide the flexibility of disabling this feature.

You're correct, there's currently no API or preference to disable this functionality. We would need to add support for this. Perhaps we can add a preference (and a product customization preference) to use only infopops.

(In reply to comment #4) > You're correct, there's currently no API or preference to disable this > functionality. We would need to add support for this. Perhaps we can add a > preference (and a product customization preference) to use only infopops.
Currently, is there any workaround to bypass the info popup and to open the help window directly on F1?
Should this be considered as an enhancement?
For bypassing the infopop see bug 88822.

bug.short_desc: 404 Error when attempting to mirror Eclipse Platform Update site

long_desc.thetext:
I am attempting to create a local mirror of the 3.2 Update site via the command line options of the update manager. org.eclipse.rcp, org.eclipse.platform and org.eclipse.sdk all fail to be mirrored, the latter two I think because they have org.eclipse.rcp as a sub-feature, which fails to mirror. (the remainder of the features successfully mirror)
I thus attempted to mirror just org.eclipse.rcp. It gets up to copying the plugin archives then fails with a 404 error (log below). There's a few bugs lodged about the processing of pack.gz files but nothing that mentioned a mirror of org.eclipse.rcp not working. I manually entered the failing URL in my browser to ensure I wasn't somehow using a faulty mirror, but it failed as well.
In searching for equivalent bugs, bug 149415 looked to be similar.
I am using Eclipse 3.2 and the Sun 1.5 JVM on a Windows XP platform to do the mirroring.
Thanks Michael

Hi Denis, Digest url is specified on digestURL attribute in site tag of site.xml. It is actually the directory of digest.zip so if for instance you specify digestURL="mysite.com/update" will will attemp to access mysite.com/update/digest.zip. I looked into http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/site.xml and digestURL is set to: http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/ not http://update.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip This looks like a problem on your side. Please reclaim the bug.

The webmaster doesn't control site.xml. I've asked the releng team to take a look, perhaps this should also be reassigned to them?
-M.

My bug appears to have been hijacked somewhat here - its about the inability to mirror the update site, not the URL for the digest file. I'm assuming the digest problem does not affect the ability to mirror the update site - granted it needs to be fixed but perhaps it should be a separate bug.
My aim is to establish a mirror of the 3.2 update site behind our firewall and at the moment the ?bug I lodged is preventing us from doing so.
Based on the wiki documentation at http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Update_Site_Optimization (maybe no pack200 means no looking for .pakc.gz files), I thought I'd try using a 1.4.2_09 Sun JVM instead, but the effect was the same (see log below).
Is the standaloneUpdate perhaps assuming that because the pack200 attribute is true, it should always find both the .jar and the .jar.pack.gz files and mirror both?
If the problem is a bug, could the .pack.gz files be added to the site in the interim to allow the mirror to succeed?
Thanks

bug.short_desc: Incorrect PDE -> JDT dependency on Callisto Update site

long_desc.thetext:
* Install a clean eclipse-platform-3.2-win32 * Start it and go to Callisto Discovery Site * Select the PDE --> Error is shown: "Eclipse Plug-in Development Environment (3.2.0.v20060609m------6zXJJzJzJq) requires plug-in "org.eclipse.jdt (3.0.0)", or compatible." * Click "Select Required" button --> Nothing happens * Manually select the JDT feature --> The error goes away
I think that selecting the PDE feature should automatically have a depedencey to JDT, such that "Select Required" works.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 147051 ***

I've turn off XML validations. I use eclipse since version 3.0 , but the problem has no change.
my laptop: cpu centrino 1.73G memory 1G

bug.short_desc: [persistence] PropertySet attached to IHost gets moved during quit & restart

long_desc.thetext: I find this bug particularly dangerous since it's API breaking. Could we consider this for 1.0.1?
*** Bug 176018 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This bug severe and critical. We are kept going in our work only by locally patching the RSEDOMImporter, line 131. The workaround is not acceptable as the properties are per host instance and not per single connector service.
I made the change suggested by Martin, but I am not closing the defect until I have some tests written to verify that. Unfortunately, I cannot do that until I have completed some further refactoring.

David, FYI: We are using the the patched RSEDOMImporter now quite a while (in both versions, locally patched and from HEAD). As we depend on this change, we can say that it works quite well and as expected :).
Good. Changing bug to resolved.

bug.short_desc: Inconsistent File Size Descriptions

long_desc.thetext: Please change (xxx Meg) to (xxx MB)
The file sizes have been removed from that page because the size is fairly small, even for non-broadband users (< 5 MB)

bug.short_desc: GMFMAP: List of available elements for "Domain meta information -> Element" should be restricted

long_desc.thetext:
In GMFMAP the list "Domain meta information -> Element" includes elements which can not be instantiated. For example when including the Ecore.ecore model one can choose EObject as the semantical element of a node. If you do so, you can create a node in the generated editor but you can not delete it.
So IMHO the list of available elements should be restricted to elements which can be instantiated. Furthermore corresponding rules should be added to the validation process.
See also Bug #149787 <https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=149787>
Since GMF 2.0 M6 was released April 5, 2007, doing a bulk move of all open Bugzillas currently on M6 to 2.0 M7. Owners will need to access if the issue really is targetted for 2.0 M7.
Only EClasses !isAbstract() && !isInterface() are returned by corresponding ItemProvider from now.

bug.short_desc: cannot open faces-config.xml within non-jsf project

long_desc.thetext:
Opening any faces-config.xml just after installing Callisto + WTP + JSF gives me the following stacktrace:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95) at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.FacesConfigEditor.loadModel(FacesConfigEditor.java:334) at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.FacesConfigEditor.setInput(FacesConfigEditor.java:323) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.init(FormEditor.java:132) at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.FacesConfigEditor.init(FacesConfigEditor.java:296) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.createSite(EditorManager.java:839) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorReference.createPartHelper(EditorReference.java:583) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorReference.createPart(EditorReference.java:372) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPartReference.getPart(WorkbenchPartReference.java:566) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorReference.getEditor(EditorReference.java:214) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.busyOpenEditorBatched(WorkbenchPage.java:2588) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.busyOpenEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:2521) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.access$10(WorkbenchPage.java:2513) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage$9.run(WorkbenchPage.java:2498) at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:67) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.openEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:2493) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.openEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:2478) at org.eclipse.ui.ide.IDE.openEditor(IDE.java:388)
target for 0.5.1

I added a dialog to inform user, but for the exception, since we use the faces-config editor (not a plain file editor) to open that file, and we need to get information from that web project (for example, get the project's WebContent folder), the exception will still exists.
User can figure out what happens from the popup dialog and exception descriptions.

So, it will not be possible to open a faces-config.xml just because it is not in the proper project ? That sounds *very* restrictive?
All other editors I know of uses whatever information they have, and then provide functionality accordingly. Thus if it is not in a WTP project it can't provide what it need for webcontent, but that should definitly not be an excuse for not opening the editor?!

User can use the text based editor to open this file. The Faces-config Editor depends on some web contents in initialization, therefore, without the web project, it is not able to load the faces-config model. Without the model, it doesn't make sense to open the faces-config.xml in this editor.

So, could you please then *not* configure the JSF plugin as the default editor to handle faces-config.xml since it is not possible to choose an alternate editor when e.g. opening it up via the resource dialog.
This is *really* annoying and the first time I've seen this in any eclipse editor!
Seriously - this is *bad* behavior for a eclipse "blessed" editor!

Jean,
I am in agreement with Max that we should attempt to open the editor without requiring a WTP faceted project.
At the moment, at least, there is no dependency on the JSF Facet that I am aware of. However I am aware of the dependency on SSE. Does SSE require the WTP WebProject facet? What exactly is the dependency here?
I have reopened this bug to continue this discussion.
Thanks, GK
SSE does not require a such a facet. I extend the structured xml editors just fine without any facets ;)

FacesConfigArtifactEdit requires that the file to be opened (and related models constructed) be relative to the project's "WebContent" folder, and I believe that this requirement is not imposed by FacesConfigArtifactEdit itself, but by its superclass, ArtifactEdit. I will investigate further.

We need to use a subclass of WTP's ArtifactEdit in order to get synchronization of our EMF model and the SSE model. A limitation of using ArtifactEdit is that it is necessary to pass a URI that is relative to the WTP "WebContent" folder. Thus, the requirement is not introduced by the JSF tooling, rather it is necessary in order to use the capabilities of WTP's ArtifactEdit class. In short, considerable work would be required outside of the scope of the JSF tooling in order to make it possible to load our EMF- and SSE-based Faces Config Editor (and to keep the 2 models synchronized) in the absence of the web facet.
Perhaps we could inform the user that hits this condition that advanced editing capabilities are available for faces-config files when those files exist in a JSF (and web) faceted project, then launch the SSE XML editor instead? Just an idea. (Not opening any editor at all seems wrong, in my opinion.)

By the time the exception is caught, the Faces-config editor is already loaded. So, we can't open another editor, util the exception is handled and the Faces-config editor is closed. I have not found a way to close the Faces-config editor when the exception and load the SEE editor. I will investigate further. If you know how this can be handled, let me know.

It is truely a shame that what is basically just a fancy (but really nice) xml editor requires a very specific project structure and configuration ;(
Is all the form editing really 110% tied into it's souroundings ? The only "externally" dependent page i see is the visual navigation page, but even that can be more or less fully build from the content of the faces-config.xml file.
The real solution here is to just disable the things that is not possible when just having the .xml file (and I don't see what parts that is, so that would be interesting to hear). And then the source page would at least be useful for editing.
If that is not possible because of problems with SEE/ArtifactEdit we should open up a bug against them.

Kevin,
It sounds like your files are not contained within a dynamic web project. To resolve this, I would create a new Dynamic Web project with a JSF configuration and then move your existing project files into this new project.
Yes, this could/should be made easier. There should be a wizard to add dynamic web app capabilities to any project. I would recommend making an enhancement request against wst.web for this.
Incidentally, if you had exported your original app as a WAR, there are import facilities to create a dynamic web app from the WAR.
Created an attachment (id=46838) Demonstrates a possible way to handle the exception problem

(In reply to comment #10) > Faces-config editor when the exception and load the SEE editor. I will > investigate further. If you know how this can be handled, let me know.
Hi Jean,
I have attached a patch that shows a possible way that this might be handled. Take a look and let me know what you think.

Thank you. I think it works pretty good.
Basically we check if the project has web & jsf facet, if not, then simply use SSE editor (one of the editor's tabs) to open it.

bug.short_desc: No support statement for Profile on Server.

long_desc.thetext:
No support statement for Profile on Server.
Assuming TPTP supports all servers that WTP supports, we do not provide a support statement analogous to our TPTP v4.2 prerequisites and tested operating systems and JRE combinations (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/project_info/releaseinfo/4.2/support.html) that details which servers we test and provide primary and secondary support. This information could be added to http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/project_info/releaseinfo/4.2/support.html#Profile on server.
If we do not support the same servers that WTP supports, we should wither add support or disable this function in the UI with the applicable documentation.

The correct location for this information is in the on-line user documentation, not the JRE/OS support page. For large log support, the databases are listed in the on-line docs. Only JRE and operating systems are in the support.html file.

Incidentally I haven't seen a requirement that TPTP support the same servers as WTP. I know that's the ideal but until someone actually needs it then I think that we shouldn't invest the time into adding the support because we're short on resources as it is.

Created an attachment (id=53169) new plugin for profile on server support
This new plugin enabled user doc for profile on server feature, and within the help doc there is a support statement about the server runtimes been tested.
Created an attachment (id=53170) a screen cap of the new help page, and it's anchor in list of contents

Hi Eugene,
Good first draft. Thanks for the screen cap - made reviewing the doc much easier. I have a few comments:
1. Rename the topic title (in both the navigation and the page itself) to "Profiling an application on a server" 2. The wording of the first sentence has a couple of typos ('intergration' and 'debg'). Plus I found the first sentence to be long and suggest that either you remove the reference to WTP or split the two ideas into two sentences, e.g. "TPTP has integrated with WTP to bring you the profile on server function. With this function you can profile..." 3. Instead of saying that the list of supported servers is limited to what WTP supports, the supported list of servers must list only the ones that we have tested (Apache Tomcat & JBoss). Also list the versions of Tomcat & JBoss that have been tested. The Note should read something like, "You can profile on Apache Tomcat version X and JBoss version Y. Other servers and other versions have not been tested." If you believe that other servers or versions will work then you can add that "...have not been tested but we believe that they should work." 4. Typo: "Note that a sever instance" should be "Note that a server instance"
The build needs to include the new plugin org.eclipse.tptp.platform.profile.server.doc.user (a platform plugin), as well as updating the feature file of org.eclipse.tptp.platform.profile.server.

org.eclipse.tptp.platform.profile.server.doc.user is checked in to HEAD under platform module.
Hubert, please update build and feature files. THANKS!
THANKS Ruth for reviewing the doc content.

Closing.

bug.short_desc: [ds] Declarative Services too coupled and wrong parser

long_desc.thetext:
The declarative services uses a standard manifest parsers for the Service-Component header. However, the syntax for the Service-Component header deviates in several ways from the "standard" headers. It accepts path names in quotes and it does not support attributes or directives.
Also, the manifest parser is in some util package that is part of the framework. This makes it impossible to use the bundles on other frameworks.
Created an attachment (id=46002) Removes a dependency on manifest parser and replaces it with a simple parser

Peter, I thought all headers in the OSGi spec stated that the framework should ignore unrecognized attributes or directives on headers. This allows frameworks to place additional framework specific things to the headers.
Can you give an example header to explain what "It accepts path names in quotes" means? Why is this needed? If it is needed then do we need the same thing for Bundle-NativeCode, which specifies paths to native code libraries?
I do not understand why you say using Import-Package couples the DS implementation to Equinox. The DS implementation uses Import-Package to get access to the util package with the manifest parser so that package can easily be exported by another bundle when installed on another framework. That is the beauty of Import-Package, right? You can substitute the package implementation at deployment time. This has always been the OSGi argument for using Import-Package, it does NOT couple your bundles like Require-Bundle.
Also note that DS is implicitly coupled to the framework implementation to get access to the BundleContext. I know Peter knows this (because he ported that part to Apache Felix :), but others need to understand this.

1. The Service-Component header does not allow parameters We discussed to make the Service-Component header inline with standard headers. However, it still means the build in parser should be fixed.
2. The first parameter is a path, which is defined to optional be bounded by quotes. See the 1.4.2. I do not think you accept the quotes in the current parser
3. The util package drags in
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core (.MessageResourceBundle); which uses: org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor (FrameworkAdaptor) which uses: org.eclipse.osgi.framework.log (FrameworkLog) org.eclipse.osgi.service.resolver (PlatformAdmin+State) which uses: org.eclipse.osgi.internal.resolver (StateObjectFactoryImpl) which uses: org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core (Constants) org.eclipse.osgi.internal.module (ResolverImpl) org.eclipse.osgi.service.resolver org.eclipse.osgi.storagemanager (StorageManager)
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.debug (.Debug);
Ad nauseum ... Basically you drag in the whole Equinox Framework. This web of dependencies is bad. Require Bundle AND Import-Package both couple/create dependencies. The reason I dislike RB is that it couples to the wrapper, not the content. Because you have no control over the content, you usually couple yourself to too much.
4. The coupling ds-framework is done very nicely. Anybody that implements getContent on bundle will work. It is likely that this convention will win many hearts for R5. But this should obviously be documented.
5. If you update the manifest parser to handle the quotes in the path, expanding the multiple name/paths to different manifest element entries. This makes the handling a lot easier because you do not have to handle these different cases. I am using a Map of Map to represent a header, however, because the order of the clauses is relevant, you need a LinkedHashMap, which is not available in ee.foundation. However, it is not hard to make an ordered map.
6. I am a bit puzzled by the resistance I feel ...

Sorry if you feel resistence, that was not my intention ...
I was simply asking why attributes and directives cannot exist in the header. This sparked a discussion in OSGi to modify the specification so that Service-Component uses the same generic header syntax as the rest of the OSGi headers (this is good). I was also trying to state why we use the same manifest parser for all header processing in Equinox.
I still am not sure why we need quoted paths, can you give an example where it is required to use a quoted path to specify a Service-Component path? If the answer is that is what the spec says, then there must be some rational for it. I would like to understand that rational.
Your point 3 "The util package drags in ..." is understandable. We are working on a bundle that contains versions of these packages that do not pull in the complete Equinox framework. Once this is done you should be able to use the Equinox DS implementation on another framework as long as that framework uses the convention you outlined in point 4.
I think it is fair and healthy to have discussions between the bug reporter and eclipse developer so that we all understand the issues before integrating any fixes. At times that may sound like resistence but honestly the eclipse developers need to understand all aspects of a fix before it is released because we are on the hook to support it for years to come. In the end the simplest solution may be to just create a "private" header parser for DS, but I would much prefer to just "share" the same code so as the rest of Equinox. This way if there is a bug in the parser we only have to update one bundle, not every bundle we copied the code into.

I opened bug 150545 to address the bugs in the manifest parser (ManifestElement class).
(In reply to comment #3) > 5. If you update the manifest parser to handle the quotes in the path, > expanding the multiple name/paths to different manifest element entries. > This makes the handling a lot easier because you do not have to handle > these different cases. I am using a Map of Map to represent a header, > however, because the order of the clauses is relevant, you need > a LinkedHashMap, which is not available in ee.foundation. However, > it is not hard to make an ordered map.
This change in behavior cannot be done to ManifestElement class. In some cases the grouping of the paths matters. For example, in Bundle-NativeCode we need to keep the paths together in one manifest element so that we can select the single manifest element to install the native code paths.

there is no resistance, just other things to consider.
In general I am in support of where Peter is driving (independence, decoupling etc). However, this does not mean that we have to write every bundle from first principles. For exmaple Equinox has a very high performance (speed and space) message NLS mechanism. All the bundles we write will use that. An implementation of that mechanims is or will be available in additional bundles from Equionx (e.g., the supplement bundle). So, someone wanting to use the Equinox DS will have to get the ds bundle and some bundle that implements the required packages (e.g., the supplement bundle). Our model for the supplement bundle is that is should contain all the things from the Equionx OSGi bundle that are not standard/conventional. This is something we are currently refining and working through.
Tom's point about DS impls being inherently tied to a framework because of the bundle context hook is apt however I would hope that going forward we will either have a standardized version of that hook or our DS impl will have explicit codings for different frameworks.
The new implementation from prosyst no longer uses the equinox manifest parser. Wontfix this in the old DS codebase.

attachment.desc: Removes a dependency on manifest parser and replaces it with a simple parser

bug.short_desc: org.aspectj.ajde.core testcases create "out" directory in project root

long_desc.thetext: Certain tests e.g. BasicCommandTestCase use a directory called "out" for compilation results. This is created in the project root and after a refresh becomes an outgoing CVS change. The tests should use ajcSandbox.

those tests do actually tidy up after themselves - but perhaps in your new config they dont tidy up the right place... i agree moving all output to sandbox is preferable.
(And some of the ltw tests create 'results.ser' on the disk and don't tidy up...)

That's what I thought and maybe it's true if you run all the tests. However if you run org.aspectj.ajdt.core/EajcModuleTests and refresh the workspace you _will_ get an "out" folder and I can't find any tidy-up logic. The result.ser problem will be harder to track down.

\tests\java5\ataspectj\ataspectj\bugs\CflowBelowStackTest creates result.ser. This is a cut & paste of the submitted testcase for Bug 120351 which actually failed during compile/weaver. Will remove redundant logic that creates the file.

Getting rid of the "out" directory was a little harder. Simply adding CommandTestCase.tearDown() to delete the directory didn't work because it was added to the classpath when running tests and not freed until the class loader GC'd. Instead I used Ajc.createEmptySandbox() and made its use implicit by making checkCompile() an instance method and adding a runMain() helper method.
Fix available

bug.short_desc: Jndi - password and username

long_desc.thetext:
Hello,
i use Eclipse 3.2, Birt 2.1, JBoss 4.0.2, Report Engine Api 2.1. I am using the Report Engine API to generate the report within my jboss-webapplication. So far so good. All works fine with a jdbc connection.
Now i want to change the datasource from jdbc to jndi. This works fine, when i use the same user and password for the jdbc source and jndi source.
My foo-ds.xml file looks like this:
.............. <no-tx-datasource> <jndi-name>cro24.xtrial.ds.foo.read-only</jndi-name> <connection-url>jdbc:postgresql://localhost/foo</connection-url> <driver-class>org.postgresql.Driver</driver-class> <user-name>foo_user</user-name> <password>foo_pw</password> <min-pool-size>5</min-pool-size> <max-pool-size>10</max-pool-size> <idle-timeout-minutes>5</idle-timeout-minutes> <!--<track-statements>true</track-statements>--> </no-tx-datasource> ............
My birt-xml-file looks like this:
........... <data-sources> <oda-data-source extensionID="org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc" name="Data Source" id="39"> <text-property name="displayName">Data Source</text-property> <property name="odaDriverClass">org.postgresql.Driver</property> <property name="odaURL">jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/foo</property> <property name="odaUser">foo-foo</property> <encrypted-property name="odaPassword">ZXRtc191c2VyXzAx</encrypted-property> <property name="odaJndiName">java:cro24.xtrial.ds.tabulator</property> </oda-data-source> </data-sources> ..........
All works fine, while the username and password of jdbc connection and jndi is the same. When i change the jdbc-connection to an not existing user (e.g. foo-foo) then, i get a error:
INFO: getJndiDSConnection: Unable to get JNDI data source connection; org.jboss.util.NestedSQLException: Could not create connection; - nested throwable: (org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: Passwort-Authentifizierung f??r Benutzer ??foo-foo?? fehlgeschlagen); - nested throwable: (org.jboss.resource.JBossResourceException: Could not create connection; - nested throwable: (org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: Passwort-Authentifizierung f??r Benutzer ??foo-foo?? fehlgeschlagen)) Jul 10, 2006 2:47:07 PM org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc.JDBCDriverManager doConnect FINER: Calling DriverManager.getConnection. url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/foo Jul 10, 2006 2:47:07 PM org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc.JDBCException JDBCException FINE: odajdbc.CannotGetConn Jul 10, 2006 2:47:07 PM org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc.JDBCException logSQLException FINE: SQL Exception #1 org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: Passwort-Authentifizierung f??r Benutzer ??foo-foo?? fehlgeschlagen
When i change the host to an nonexisting host (in my birt-xml-file), birt gets the correct host from the foo-ds.xml file. Why does birt not read the username and password also from foo-ds.xml? Is this a Bug?
Best regrads
orkus9

The username and password specified in the BIRT report design's jdbc data source, get passed to your JNDI resource factory to get the JNDI connection, using: javax.sql.DataSource.getConnection( username, password ) If it fails, or when no username is specified, the alternate method javax.sql.DataSource.getConnection() is called.
It's up to your JNDI resource factory (jboss) to determine how and when it uses its own configuration, e.g. your foo-ds.xml . In other words, BIRT never reads a JNDI resource configuration (foo-ds.xml) directly.

To control the value of the BIRT jdbc username and password used at runtime... the recommended way is to bind the username/password property to a report parameter. This way, the username and password used at design-time can be different from those used at runtime when deployed in a web application.

bug.short_desc: Plugins are nuked by manual update

long_desc.thetext:
Every time I do a manual update; i.e. download the new version of Eclipse and copy it into my Applications folder; all my previously installed plugins are nukled and must be reinstalled; at least on Mac OS X. (Possibly other platforms do not see this if they only overwrite files in folders rather than entire folders. I don't know.)
This is annnoying, and there's a simple fix. User installed plugins should not be in the same place that the core files are; any more than you would put all the user's code in the same directory as the core app.
Besides updates, this would assist multiuser Macs where different users may wish to install different combinations of plugins.
Have you investigated the possibility of setting up extension locations for your addons?

The user should not have to set up anything. The default should be to keep all user installed extensions in the ~Library/Application Support/Eclipse on Mac OS X. That is the standard place to install customizations, and for good reason. This enables one install to support multiple users with different options, and avoids the problem that keeps biting me. Presumably other platforms have something similar: e.g. ~/.eclipse on Linux.

One more point: installing plugins in the user's home directory means they get backed up when that directory is backed up, and the configuration is easily portable to other systems via disk sync (desktop to laptop), USB flash drive, or other means.

This bug is one of the main reason why we (in EasyEclipse) don't use the update manager (yet). Since we put some care at packaging plugins into well-managed sets, we'd prefer not to see the new set of plugins being installed on top of others. The fact that install locations aren't configurable during update (by the installed plugin) means that there's no way to manage the plugins (delete).
I think that the only way to solve this, is have the platform install under different folder automatically. Most softwares (Firefox, Photoshop...) have a "plugins" folder where the plugins goes. But we already have a "plugins" folder :-).
For EasyEclipse, on MacOS, we install the main platform on /Applications/, and additional plugins in /Library/. This is the best way to respect the OS, but not easy to do in a cross-platform way.

bug.short_desc: Incorrect dependencies in TPTP features when installing from the Callisto Discovery Site.

long_desc.thetext:
Incorrect dependencies in TPTP features when installing from the Callisto Discovery Site.
When installing TPTP from the Callisto Discovery Site, there are several issues with dependencies in TPTP features:
-Selecting the TPTP Platform Project and clicking Select Required requires the following features that are not required (based on the dependencies packaged with TPTP as delivered on the TPTP download site):
-Visual Editor -Web Standard Tools
However, it should require the following features (from Enabling Features):
-Apache Commons Logging -Apache Jakarta Log4J

WTP features include commons logging and log4j. Commons logging and log4j are also listed seperately under the "Enabling Features" section. When there are more than one features containing the dependency, the updater does not have a rule on which feature to pick. In this case, the updater picks the much larger WTP feature. This problem is already tracked with a bug for the updater team: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=146253
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 146253 ***
Please update the target to 4.2.1.

I don't think the target milestone of a bug marked as a duplicate of another bug is meaningful because I'm not fixing the problem. The target of the bug should be specified in bug 146253. I don't think the problem will be fixed by TPTP 4.2.1. I marked target as 4.3 to be more realistic.

(In reply to comment #3)
The target is the release/iteration the defect was returned as duplicate.

bug.short_desc: [Accessibility] BIRT SWT chart is not high contrast compliant

long_desc.thetext: The BIRT chart presented in the test log viewer is not displayed properly in high contrast mode. The background color remains white. The labels at the right legend are still using the same font.
Reassign to Bianca.

Created an attachment (id=47821) Software Accessibility Checklist
See item 4.3, "Support system settings for high contrast for all user interface controls and client area content."

To reproduce on windows xp:
1. Control Panel > Accessibility Options, Display tab, check "Use High Contrast". click Settings button, for "High contrast apperance scheme", select "High Contrast Black" for example. click Apply.
2. Open an BIRT SWT Chart, The chart is not in high contrast mode.

Created an attachment (id=47822) Screen shot of a Birt SWT Chart in High Contast Mode
The attached screen shot shows a Birt SWT chart in High Contrast mode.
To test birt chart background setting, I tried to set the background color of the birt chart to a hard coded color, like blue, the chart still shows up with a white background.
re-opened, meant to reassign to bianca
Does it work in Windows High Contrast mode, Dave? That was the real issue. Please see the attached screen shot.

Thanks for the sample code, David.
The sample code you have is explicitly setting the background color to blue which is not what windows High Contrast mode is about. According to the Accessiblity tutorial from microsoft, "High Contrast is an accessibility feature designed for people who have vision impairment. High Contrast color schemes can increase legibility for some users by heightening screen contrast with alternative color combinations.". Here's the link to the tutorial: http://www.microsoft.com/enable/training/windowsxp/highcontrast.aspx
So as part of the software accessibility requirement, All user interface controls and client area content should support system settings for high contrast. If the software is explicitly setting a pre-defined color, it can not respond to the system settings for high contrast.
Bianca, can you change the component to a SWT component or open a separate SWT defect that the TPTP defect is dependent on.
changing the product to BIRT/Chart engine

I need some clear requirements on what is expected in the BIRT Chart Engine. The chart model contains all the colors for labels, background, and so on. So the API caller can modify those dynamically when the chart is to be used in a High-Contrast mode. It's also possible to use the style support to do it.
We could possibly create a hard-coded High-Contrast theme of fonts and colors and switch to it, but that would bypass all the user's defined settings, which seems not to be a good idea. And in any case, what should this theme consist of (which colors for the palette, for the backgrounds, font...?).

(In reply to comment #12) > I need some clear requirements on what is expected in the BIRT Chart Engine. > The chart model contains all the colors for labels, background, and so on. So > the API caller can modify those dynamically when the chart is to be used in a > High-Contrast mode. It's also possible to use the style support to do it. > > We could possibly create a hard-coded High-Contrast theme of fonts and colors > and switch to it, but that would bypass all the user's defined settings, which > seems not to be a good idea. And in any case, what should this theme consist of > (which colors for the palette, for the backgrounds, font...?). >
If the BIRT model is set with specific colors for backgrounds, fonts etc. that is the problem for accessible applications using BIRT. Applications should use the settings provided by the platform instead of using its own so that when the system settings changes, the application can reflect that.
Since it is not possible to unset the settings in BIRT by consuming products and use that from the system, this has become a blocking issue to adopt eclipse 3.2.2 in early 2007.

Removed hard-coded colors from model, so the style will be applied for background colors correctly.
The solution for you is to create a style "high-contrast" that defines white fonts and black background color, and pass it to the chart, it should now work correctly.

(In reply to comment #14) > Removed hard-coded colors from model, so the style will be applied for > background colors correctly. > > The solution for you is to create a style "high-contrast" that defines white > fonts and black background color, and pass it to the chart, it should now work > correctly. >
David, not sure what you mean by "create a style "high-contrast" that defines white fonts and black background color, and pass it to the chart". The font and background color should reflect those from the system settings (which can be changed by the user through accessibility settings), not pre-defined in the code. Can you please clarify?
Using R-R1-2_2_0-200706261010, pie charts are not visible in high contrast mode (see https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=167513#c9).

The font and background color should reflect those from the system settings (which can be changed by the user through accessibility settings), not pre-defined in the code. Can you please clarify?

bug.short_desc: Debug "Display" command returns error

long_desc.thetext:
When debugging a java web app running inside the Jetty 4.2 container lauched from an eclipse launcher config, some JRE object types, such as String, HashMap and ArrayList cannot be "displayed" while other object types, such as an log4j Logger reference or my own classes, display successfully. The result is an internal error inside the Display view:
(java.util.HashMap) org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Unable to access archive C:\devtool\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.source_3.0.0\src\org.junit_3.8.1\junitsrc.zip
When I mouse over a String instance the contents are displayed normally. Only the Display command seems to have this issue.

This sounds like a dup of bug 138877. Sounds like an old launch config with a source path that has not been updated/migrated to the new PDE source lookup in 3.2.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 138877 ***

bug.short_desc: [Plan Item] XML Primitive Types

long_desc.thetext: Provide a model library to represent the types defined in the XMLType metamodel in EMF; be sure to update the Ecore/UML converters to make use of this new library.

I propose that the XML Schema datatype library be implemented using UML DataType instances (instead of Class or PrimitiveType). The XSD datatype spec describes the built-in types as being a small number of "primitives" and the others as "derived". Because the UML2 spec prohibits a DataType from subclassing a PrimitiveType, it is not possible to implement the XSD type inheritance with the base types as primitive.
In addition, when creating UML models of schema designs, it is natural to represent complexType with simple content (i.e. a complexType that extends a simpleType, then adds XML attributes) as a UML DataType with properties for the complexType attributes. If the entire library of XSD built-in types were represented as PrimitiveType, then they cannot be extended with a DataType that adds attributes.
How would you expect your specialized data types (with additional attributes) to be handled when converting the UML model to/from Ecore (given that data types in Ecore cannot have attributes)?

Not all UML models are converted to Ecore... my primary use case (and that of the companies I am working with) is to create UML models of XML schema designs and to generate XSD from the models. They mostly use JAXB 2.0 or XMLBeans for Java binding.
However, I would expect the Ecore conversion to be handled in the same way that Ecore models are created while importing these same kinds of structures from XSD. The structures I am referring to here is a complexType that extends a simpleType and adds attributes, a.k.a complexType with simple content. EMF import from schema does handle this, but I have not studied how it is done.
Created an attachment (id=54660) first crack at support
Created an attachment (id=54661) 2 of 4
Created an attachment (id=54662) 3 of 4
Created an attachment (id=54663) 4 of 4
(From update of attachment 54660) small modifications to come.

Thanks, James. I was planning to test this patch today but will wait for your modification. Are these patches applied against HEAD?
Will this library be delivered with a 2.0.x or 2.1 build? The sooner the better for me. I have my own XSDDataTypes library (using my XSD profile) but would like to change to this common library asap.

Hi Dave,
After discussing in more detail with Kenn (and Kenn speaking with Ed Merks) I will be making more changes shortly. ( ie complex types going to EClass not EDataTypes)
I will be delivering to the 2.1 (head). This feature is targeted for M4 but I expect that this will be ready to go in the next couple of days.
Regards,
- James.

Can we add the Generalizations between DataTypes, as defined by baseType restrictions in the XSD schema for schemas? This is very helpful for modeling tools that provide constraints on property types, e.g. must inherit from XSD String type.
I can help add these Generalizations to the library model if you like.
I can add those generalizations in (I'll have to add support for creating those automatically anyway).

Created an attachment (id=54732) Updated patch
Here is an updated patch based on the discussion I had with Ed. Basically, the XML types library will contain primitive types that have generalizations between them based on the baseType annotations from Ecore.
Dave, please hold off on applying the latest patch ... there are very minor issues with the menu items and the resources need to be updated.
Created an attachment (id=54749) update with all mods
The changes have been committed to CVS.

Dave,
The XML data types in question are marked as PrimitiveTypes. To get the kind of complex types you are looking for you need to: 1. Create a DataType. 2. Stereotype your new data type with <EClass> 3. Set the XML Content Kind to Simple 4. Create a property 5. Type the property with a Primitive type 6. Streotype your property with EAttribute. 7. Set the featureKind to "Simple".
Converting such a uml model to .ecore will now produce the kind of model you expect and also converting from .ecore to .uml will work as you want.
Let us know if you have any issues.
Available in build: I200611301324 From: http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/mdt/downloads/?project=uml2-uml

What's the problem with the solution I suggested?

bug.short_desc: JVM crash when using SWT_AWT bridge in XP

long_desc.thetext:
For the past six months I have been trying to debug a JVM crash in my RCP application without any success.
We are currently using an AWT-based terminal emulation program, incorporated into our RCP-based program using the SWT_AWT bridge class, in order to allow access my company's existing green-screen system. Our users have complained about unpredictable JVM crashes that occur while they are navigating through the green-screen system. We know for a fact that this issue is not caused by the terminal emulator because for over a year-and-a-half, our users used a stand-alone version of this exact same product without any problems. We are currently talking to the terminal emulator vendors about the issue, but they are starting to doubt that there's anything they can do about it.
The following three sample stack traces were generated by three different users doing three different things in the terminal emulator. The only consistent fact about this bug is that it occurs seemingly at random while they are switching from screen to screen, but that is the only commonality between them. All but one of our users are using JVM 1.5.0_06, one of these logs comes from the user using JVM 1.5.0_03. Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

bug.short_desc: [Operations] Revert to Base does not recreated deleted files

long_desc.thetext:
After checking out a project from a cvs repository and changing one file, the action Replace with > Another branch or version > BASE deletes the changed file from the local sandbox.
Additional symptom: After restoring the file from local history it is no longer marked as shared (i.e. it has the decorator ? instead of the expected drum).

Created an attachment (id=62757) Solution proposal
This patch works as long as resources are not marked as BASE.
Therefore this patch should be commited with patch for bug 106876 (which removes BASE tag).

I have released the patch. However, the patch solves the problem for files that have been modified but the problem still remains for files that have been deleted. Ideally, deleted files should be recreated when the user chooses "Team > Revert to BASE". One thing we could do is look in the local history to see what the last known contents for the deleted file is. If it is there, we could recreate the file with the last known contents. If there is no contents, we would need to unmanage the file as before. We would only want to do this when the tag was BASE.
Michael, could you commit PrepareForReplaceVisitor from this patch, too :> ?
I did release this patch (although I made a slight modification). I left the bug open since the delete case is still not properly handled.

Michael,
Restoring deleted files seems to be much more complicated:
Deleted file might have any tag - we cannot restore it from remote repository.
Last version from history does not have to belong to the current tag, we cannot restore files from local history, because it would add random files and then revert them to BASE.
I think the only thing I can do is check if there are any deleted files in a project and launch Restore From Repository wizard.

What I would suggest is to try and restore the file from the local history. Have a look at the IFile#getHistory() method. If one or more states are returned, use the contents from the first state. If no states are returned, there's nothing we can do (but at least we tried).
Created an attachment (id=63864) Restoring deleted files

I would prefer to see the code in the PrepareForRepalce visitor since we are already traversing the tree. When you encounter a deleted file, you could simply obtain the file history and attempt to restore from it. Also, if the restore fails, I don't think we want to stop the operation. We can either log the message or accumulate it so we can signal an error after the operation completes (we could also write it to the CVS console)
Created an attachment (id=64009) changes in PrepareForReplaceVisitor

The patch looks good but:
1) We normally put all our string in a single bundle in the org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core package
2) If I delete a folder and then perform a Revert, the folder and it's files are not recreated
3) You can get the console from ColsoleListeners.getInstance(). You could write the message as an error line and you would need to pass the Session to the PrepareForReplace visitor
Created an attachment (id=64179) suggestion applied
Patch released. I did make one minor change (i.e. I used the shouldDeleteModifiedFiles() method in the condition since it performed the same test).
Verified in I20070501-0010

bug.short_desc: [refactoring] Refactoring participant actions get lost during preview involving back, next

long_desc.thetext:
I am not sure whether to reopen Bug 132137 or Bug 139513, but since those are actually feature requests which are now basically solved, I open a new real bug report:
I experienced it with the rename refactoring; but if all of PDE's refactoring participants are implemented the same way, they likely all have the same problem: When selecting Back and Next in the refactoring preview, PDE's refactoring participant actions are lost.
Setup: You need a project with a manifest file. Create one e.g. using a PDE template:
a) File -> New -> Plug-in Project b) Enter some project name, e.g. "myPlugin" c) Next d) Next e) Select e.g. "Plug-in with a view" f) Next g) Finish
Now, rename a class which is referenced in the manifest file. For the above setup, it would be class "SampleView":
1) Select in the package explorer src/myplugin/myplugin.views/SampleView.java 2) Open the context menu on that selection: Refactor -> Rename 3) Provide a new name, e.g. "SampleView2" 4) Next -- Leads correctly to preview listing among others "Rename classes referenced in plug-in manifest files" 5) Back 6) Next -- Leads wrongly to preview listing without "Rename classes referenced in plug-in manifest files" 7) Finish -- Leads wrongly to no rename in plugin.xml
(Without steps 5) and 6), everything is fine.)
I believe this is a bug in the refactoring participant framework. markus?

Was indeed a framework problem. PDERenameParticipants are ISharableParticipants, and ProcessorBasedRefactoring did not reset the list of sharable participants for repeated calls to #checkFinalConditions(..).
Fixed in HEAD.
verified in I20060807-2000

bug.short_desc: create extension point for adding interaction event listeners and monitors

long_desc.thetext: I want to extend Mylar Monitor and register a listener in my plugin as an interaction listener, but the existing extension point 'study' and the extension point reader in monitor plugin are too specific and cannot be used in a generalised fashion

What do you want to add it for, listening to contexts, or to any kinds of interaction events? The former can be done with MylarPlugin.getContextManager().addListener(..), and the latter by creating interaction events that get logged, but not added to the context, via MylarPlugin.getDefault().notifyInteractionObserved(interactionEvent).

I am listening any kinds of interaction events.. I solved everything with an InteractionEventListener, I don't need to use the monitor extension point, but this enhancement may be useful for other work
Registering an InteractionEventListener is the right way to do this. For now there is no obvious benefit of making these listeners extension point based.

bug.short_desc: Performance degradation parsing Apache access log with rules adapter

long_desc.thetext:
There is a performance degradation in parsing Apache access logs with the regular expression rules-based adapter between TPTP 4.1 and 4.2. Here are some performance statistics:
TPTP 4.1 TPTP 4.2 --------- ---------- 184 record log file: 5.273 sec 6.379 sec (21% degradation)
62508 record log file 53.23 sec 207.75 sec (390% degradation)

Leaving this as major severity and targetting to 4.2.1 as this problem only affects rules adapters for log types whose log records include the timezone value. For TPTP supported log types this is the Apache access log only. As a workaround the static parser can be used to parse the Apache access logs which has better performance than the rules-based parser. This problem needs to be fixed in 4.2.1.

The degradation was introduced when the fixes for bugzillas https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=132225 and https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=136531 were added to org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.internal.util.TimeParser. The problem is that getTimeZoneId method is doing a string regular expression match on each element of the time zone ID array for every record in the access log. This is unnecessary because the timezone specification in the access log record timestamps does not include a three letter timezone ID. The array only needs to be processed once to determine that the timezones do not include a timezone ID.

Committed fix to TPTP Head CVS.
Changed TimeParser and ICUTimeParser to cache the timezone ID and use it for subsequent records.

bug.short_desc: [api][persistence] createHost should not persist the RSE model

long_desc.thetext:
Creating more than one host at the same time only allows persisting on disk the first entry. Other hosts fail to be saved and no exception is thrown (it migh be caught somewhere). The first instance of createHost might prevent the disk to be written by other createHost instances.
The expected behaviour should be that createHost only populates the RSE model in memory and it might be saved later on through save() or saveHost(IHost conn).
To reproduce the issue, try to run more than one createHost in a sequence, such as:
RSEUIPlugin.getDefault().getSystemRegistry().createHost( "ftp", service1.getName(), hostName, "test"); RSEUIPlugin.getDefault().getSystemRegistry().createHost( "ssh", service2.getName(), hostName, "test"); RSEUIPlugin.getDefault().getSystemRegistry().createHost( "ssh", service3.getName(), hostName, "test");
It creates all host entries in the model (they correctly appear in the tree), but only the first one is persisted, so after restarting RSE, just the first one appears.
As a workaround I have a Job saving the model scheduled some seconds later, but it shouldn't be the final solution.
I fully agree with Javier. This is an API issue so I'm increasing priority.

Currently all calls to createHost will persist the host. The problem here was that the second and third hosts were not being persisted. That has been verified to be fixed.
Bugzilla 163592 has been opened for an API change to allow explicit program control over persistence of model objects after R1. This will allow creation/modification of several hosts (and other objects) to be saved with a single call either to the profile manager or system registry.

Verified. However, cannot use SystemRegistry calls to create or delete hosts off of the UI thread. SystemTeamViewPart is a listener for these actions and attempts to adjust the tree. Need to make these tree adjustments on the UI thread. Will open a separate bug for that.

Please attach the report design.

Created an attachment (id=46034) Report design
Removed database password.
Database is MySQL 3.23, table structure is:
CREATE TABLE `database_size` ( `ID` int(10) unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment, `date` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL default '0', `system_ID` varchar(20) NOT NULL default '', `size_bytes` varchar(30) NOT NULL default '', PRIMARY KEY (`ID`), KEY `date_key` (`date`), KEY `system_key` (`system_ID`) ) TYPE=MyISAM ;
The "date" field is a millisecond timestamp value.

This exception is likely caused by the lack of support of ResultSetMetaData.getColumnClassName() method in the JDBC driver you use. Can you try using a different JDBC driver (such as MySQL Connector/J) to access your MySQL DB?
We will make a fix in BIRT so that the lack of support of this JDBC method will not stop BIRT from accessing the database. This fix will be made available in the 2.1.1 release.
I am using an old MySQL driver: mm.mysql-2.0.6.jar
A modificatin is made to fix the bug. Birt will not be stopped when ResultSetMetaData.getColumnClassName() method is not supported in the JDBC driver.
